title: Hot Dog Sales: Stemplots and Outliers
question_text: For the past $24$ days, Oscar has been keeping track of the number of hot dogs sold daily at his hot dog cart.  His data is displayed in the stemplot below. Loading question supplement... Which of the following statements accurately describes the outliers in this distribution?

choices.text: There is only one outlier and it occurs at 12 12 hot dogs.
There is only one outlier and it occurs at 62 62 hot dogs.
There are two outliers.  One outlier is at 12 12 hot dogs and the other outlier is at 62 62 hot dogs.
There are three outliers.  One outlier is at 12 12 hot dogs, another is at 57 57 hot dogs, and another is at 62 62 hot dogs.
